With a population of almost 1.9 million, it is the second most populous in Greece after [[Attica (region)|Attica]]. == Administration == The region was established in the 1987 administrative reform. With the 2010 [[Kallikratis plan]], its powers and authority were redefined and extended. Along with [[East Macedonia and Thrace]], it is supervised by the Decentralized Administration of Macedonia and Thrace which is based in [[Thessaloniki]]. The region is based at its capital city of [[Thessaloniki]] and is divided into seven [[regional units of Greece|regional units]] (pre-Kallikratis [[prefectures of Greece|prefectures]]), [[Chalkidiki]], [[Imathia]], [[Kilkis (regional unit)|Kilkis]], [[Pella (regional unit)|Pella]], [[Pieria (regional unit)|Pieria]], [[Serres (regional unit)|Serres]] and [[Thessaloniki (regional unit)|Thessaloniki]]. These are further subdivided into 38 [[Municipalities of Greece|municipalities]]. Although geographically part of central Macedonia, [[Mount Athos]] is not administratively part of the region, but an autonomous self-governing state under the sovereignty of Greece. ==Economy==
